v-btn.doc: The v-btn component replaces the standard html button with a material design theme and multiple options. Buttons communicate actions that users can take.

props.name: activeClass
props.doc: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

props.name: backgroundColor
props.doc: Changes the background-color for the component.

props.name: borderless
props.doc: Removes the group's border.

props.name: color
props.doc: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

props.name: dark
props.doc: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

props.name: dense
props.doc: Reduces the button size and padding.

props.name: group
props.doc: Generally used in [v-toolbar](/components/toolbars) and [v-app-bar](/components/app-bars). Removes background color, border and increases space between the buttons

props.name: light
props.doc: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

props.name: max
props.doc: Sets a maximum number of selections that can be made.

props.name: multiple
props.doc: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value

props.name: rounded
props.doc: Round edge buttons

props.name: shaped
props.doc: Applies a large border radius on the top left and bottom right of the card.

props.name: tile
props.doc: Removes the component's border-radius.

props.name: value
props.doc: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

v-btn-toggle.doc: The v-btn-toggle component is a group of buttons that act as a toggle or radio selection. It's useful for creating grouped action buttons.

props.name: color
props.doc: Applies specified color to the control - it can be the name of material color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). You can find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

props.name: dark
props.doc: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

props.name: dayFormat
props.doc: Formats day of the month string that appears in a day to a specified locale

props.name: end
props.doc: The ending date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

props.name: eventColor
props.doc: A background color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

props.name: eventEnd
props.doc: Set property of *event*'s end timestamp.

props.name: eventHeight
props.doc: The height of an event in pixels in the `month` view and at the top of the `day` views.

props.name: eventMarginBottom
props.doc: Margin bottom for event

props.name: eventMore
props.doc: Whether the more 'button' is displayed on a calendar with too many events in a given day. It will say something like '5 more' and when clicked generates a `click:more` event.

props.name: eventMoreText
props.doc: The text to display in the more 'button' given the number of hidden events.

props.name: eventName
props.doc: Set property of *event*'s displayed name, or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar as the first argument and a flag signalling whether the name is for a timed event (true) or an event over a day.

props.name: eventOverlapMode
props.doc: One of `stack`, `column`, or a custom render function

props.name: eventOverlapThreshold
props.doc: A value in minutes that's used to determine whether two timed events should be placed in column beside each other or should be treated as slightly overlapping events.

props.name: eventRipple
props.doc: Applies the `v-ripple` directive.

props.name: eventStart
props.doc: Set property of *event*'s start timestamp.

props.name: eventTextColor
props.doc: A text color for all events or a function which accepts an event object passed to the calendar to return a color.

props.name: events
props.doc: An array of event objects with a property for a start timestamp and optionally a name and end timestamp. If an end timestamp is not given, the value of start will be used. If no name is given, you must provide an implementation for the `event` slot.

props.name: firstInterval
props.doc: The first interval to display in the `day` view. If `intervalMinutes` is set to 60 and this is set to 9 the first time in the view is 9am.

props.name: hideHeader
props.doc: If the header at the top of the `day` view should be visible.

props.name: intervalCount
props.doc: The number of intervals to display in the `day` view.

props.name: intervalFormat
props.doc: Formats time of day string that appears in the interval gutter of the `day` and `week` view to specified locale

props.name: intervalHeight
props.doc: The height of an interval in pixels in the `day` view.

props.name: intervalMinutes
props.doc: The number of minutes the intervals are in the `day` view. A common interval is 60 minutes so the intervals are an hour.

props.name: intervalStyle
props.doc: Returns CSS styling to apply to the interval.

props.name: intervalWidth
props.doc: The width of the interval gutter on the left side in the `day` view.

props.name: light
props.doc: Applies the light theme variant to the component.

props.name: locale
props.doc: The locale of the calendar.

props.name: maxDays
props.doc: The maximum number of days to display in the custom calendar if an `end` day is not set.

props.name: minWeeks
props.doc: The minimum number of weeks to display in the `month` or `week` view.

props.name: monthFormat
props.doc: Formats month string that appears in a day to specified locale

props.name: now
props.doc: Override the day & time which is considered now. This is in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`. The calendar is styled according to now.

props.name: shortIntervals
props.doc: If true, the intervals in the `day` view will be 9 AM as opposed to 09:00 AM

props.name: shortMonths
props.doc: Whether the short versions of a month should be used (Jan vs January).

props.name: shortWeekdays
props.doc: Whether the short versions of a weekday should be used (Mon vs Monday).

props.name: showIntervalLabel
props.doc: Checks if a given day and time should be displayed in the interval gutter of the `day` view.

props.name: showMonthOnFirst
props.doc: Whether the name of the month should be displayed on the first day of the month.

props.name: start
props.doc: The starting date on the calendar (inclusive) in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. This may be ignored depending on the `type` of the calendar.

props.name: type
props.doc: A string which is one of `month`, `week`, `day`, `4day`, `custom-weekly`, `custom-daily`, and `category`. The custom types look at the `start` and `end` dates passed to the component as opposed to the `value`.

props.name: value
props.doc: A date in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD` which determines what span of time for the calendar.

props.name: weekdayFormat
props.doc: Formats day of the week string that appears in the header to specified locale

props.name: weekdays
props.doc: Specifies which days of the week to display. To display Monday through Friday only, a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]` can be used. To display a week starting on Monday a value of `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 0]` can be used.

slots.name: event
slots.doc: The content placed in an event. This ignores the `event-name` prop.

slots.name: day
slots.doc: The content that is placed in a `week` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: day-body

props.timeToY: (time: string | number | {hour: number, minute: number}, clamp: boolean = false): number

slots.doc: The content that is placed in a `day` view in the scrollable interval container. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: day-header

props.timeToY: (time: string | number | {hour: number, minute: number}, clamp: boolean = false): number

slots.doc: The content that is placed in a `day` view in the top container. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: day-label
slots.doc: The content that is placed in the day of the month space in the `custom-weekly` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: day-label-header
slots.doc: The content that is placed in the day of the month space in the `week`, `day`, `4day`, or `custom-daily` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: day-month
slots.doc: The content that is placed in the month space in the `week` or `month` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

slots.name: interval

props.timeToY: (time: string | number | {hour: number, minute: number}, clamp: boolean = false): number

slots.doc: The content that is placed in the interval space in the `day` view. The day & time object is passed through this slots scope.

props.name: activator
props.doc: Designate a custom activator when the `activator` slot is not used. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node.

props.name: attach
props.doc: Specifies which DOM element that this component should detach to. String can be any valid querySelector and Object can be any valid Node. This will attach to the root `v-app` component by default.

props.name: closeDelay
props.doc: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

props.name: contentClass
props.doc: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

props.name: dark
props.doc: Applies the dark theme variant to the component. This will default the components color to _white_ unless you've configured your [application theme](/customization/theme) to **dark** or if you are using the **color** prop on the component. You can find more information on the Material Design documentation for [dark themes](https://material.io/design/color/dark-theme.html).

props.name: persistent
props.doc: Clicking outside of the element or pressing **esc** key will not deactivate it.

props.name: scrollable

props.doc: Display the "next" and "prev" buttons on hover. `show-arrows` MUST ALSO be set.

props.name: touch
props.doc: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

props.name: touchless
props.doc: Disable touch support.

props.name: value
props.doc: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

props.name: vertical
props.doc: Uses a vertical transition when changing windows.

v-window.doc: The v-window component provides a base for creating sliding window presentations like carousels and steppers.

props.name: activeClass
props.doc: Configure the active CSS class applied when the link is active. You can find more information about the [**active-class** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the vue-router documentation.

props.name: disabled
props.doc: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method

props.name: eager
props.doc: Will force the components content to render on mounted. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

props.name: reverseTransition
props.doc: Sets the reverse transition

props.name: transition
props.doc: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in transitions](/styles/transitions) or one your own.

props.name: value
props.doc: Controls whether the component is visible or hidden.

v-window-item.doc: A single panel/slide within a v-window component.

props.name: group
props.doc: Creates a `transition-group` component. [vue docs](https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#transition-group)

props.name: hideOnLeave
props.doc: Hides the leaving element (no exit animation)

props.name: leaveAbsolute
props.doc: Absolutely positions the leaving element (useful for [FLIP](https://aerotwist.com/blog/flip-your-animations/))

props.name: mode
props.doc: Sets the transition mode (does not apply to transition-group). You can find more information on the Vue documentation [for transition modes](https://vuejs.org/v2/api/#transition).

props.name: origin
props.doc: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).
